messages.message: When creating a brand new app, can we consider having a tutorial where upon uploading the documents, its has you create the classes and then the fields. As someone that is just getting back into build mode, it was not clear of the create class in the top right corner

It is designed this way because not all customers want to classify document. But we can certainly looking into adjusting that upon feedback. In documentation, we included instructions explaining the path to create class and then fields if your documents have multiple types.

AIHub should be pretty self sufficient within the UI itself without having to read the documentation IMHO. The create class field is hidden behind three dots. Can we consider exposing create class a different way?

@Bastiane I think based on the latest testing, these steps for build where it auto detects the class is not accurate anymore. https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com/docs/aihub/build/#create-a-build-project
We have that on our board. It's just for the initial launch, we need to rely on the documentation. We can certainly look into improve that in the future.
We also have a draft for updated build documentation cc @melissa.amos

@Bastiane im wondering why this wouldnt be the approach for initial launch as well? If you have a user having to use the documentation on our new features, we can loose users. I stopped using some of the online tools out there cause i had to go to their documentation.
We just won't be able to introduce more changes. The launch is next Tuesday.
